intro: Thymus serpyllum f. natronatus, commonly known as the natronatus thyme, is a rare and distinctive variant of the common thyme. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and aromatic, gray-green foliage. The leaves are typically smaller and more densely packed compared to the standard form, giving it a unique appearance. This subspecies is native to specific regions in Europe and is often found in rocky or limestone soils. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
